newsitem.title: UK: LCE coffee compounds early strength after NY rally.
newsitem.headline: LCE coffee compounds early strength after NY rally.

text.p: Robusta coffee futures ended firmer on Wednesday as fund and speculator buying of arabica positions in New York added to the London market's earlier strength, traders said.

Although all positions closed off their intraday highs -- including the second-month November contract, which ended up $26 at $1,680 -- the contract edged towards chart resistance at $1,700 per tonne.
"It's fund and spec buying in the New York that's pushing it higher," said one London trader.
Market sources said concerns about a shortage of coffee available for delivery against New York's spot September contract were causing the arabica market to rally.
The September contract enters its delivery period on Thursday.
Earlier in the session, robusta futures saw light speculator-led buying across the board, which was countered by origin selling to bring values slightly off the highs.
